Name: Here to Slay: Berserkers & Necromancers
Description:
Unleash your fury and harness dark magic with this Berserkers & Necromancers 'Here to Slay' expansion! This expansion features new party leaders, heroes, and dangerous monsters! The Berserker class is lead by The Raging Manticore, a wild cat granting a draw 2 bonus each time you Slay a Monster card. Alongside the furious felines are the Berserker class headed by The Gnawing Dread, a dog Party Leader allowing players to spend 2 action points to search the discard pile for a card to add to their hand.

Contents:

    31 standard-sized cards
    2 oversized Party Leader cards
    2 oversized Monster cards


- description from the publisher

Name: Goetia: Nine Kings of Solomon – Blessed D20 Promo Tile
Description:
Spiel 2021 promotional Scry Board/Dark Board tile.

Dark Board text: “You sense a Demonic presence! Whilst walking the hallways of SPIEL, you hear the D20 roll mysteriously. In exchange for some resources, the Demon possessing the D20 will grant you its powers!”

Name: Shards of the Jaguar: The Second Trial
Description:
A module pack for Shards of the Jaguar containing 5 modules:
- Cooperative game mode
- Hidden escape module
- Dynamic actions module
- Alternative character abilities
- Event module

Name: Lost Ruins of Arnak: Alicorn Promo Card
Description:
A promo card originally available through SPIEL 2021.
Later available as part of the Game Boy Geek Season 10 Kickstarter and Man vs Meeple Season 4 Kickstarter.

The card was created by CGE as a tribute to celebrate the 25th anniversary of Kulkmann’s G@mebox (www.boardgame.de). The Alicorn is a reference to the G@mebox’ unicorn logo.

Text on the card: Then turn the guardian face down without using its boon.

Name: Sacrifice
Description:
In Sacrifice, 5 players take turns placing cubes in a grid, hoping to score many points.  Players may only place a cube in the left-most empty space of a row.  Some spaces require a player to remove other cubes they have placed.

Once every space on the board is full, the game ends and players are awarded points based upon the spaces they occupy, with a bonus in each row for whomever has the most and second-most cubes.

The player with the most points wins.

The game also includes a variant for 4 people to play with a non-player character taking the fifth color.

Name: Mistsmall: Mistfall in 18 Cards
Description:
Mistsmall is posted with permission from NSKN Games. Mistsmall is only for personal print and play game for free download. You can find the files for Mistsmall in the files section.

Mistsmall is a fan-made game that reduces Mistfall to 18 cards and a few tokens. Mistsmall uses the game's original art, helping capture the feeling of playing big Mistfall. Play as Crow, using your feats, gear and resolve to traverse dangerous regions and defeat The Abomination.

Players will move from location to location, playing cards from their hand and using their gear to manage the current encounter, deal damage to and block damage from enemies, and manipulate the board state.

The game ends in victory when players reach the final location and defeat the special encounter. The game is lost when players must take damage but are unable to. Players take damage by Burying cards from their hand, deck and discard pile.

Name: Sidereal Confluence: Bifurcation
Description:
Sidereal Confluence: Bifurcation includes variations on each of the nine original species, providing entirely new mechanisms, new strategies, and new avenues for negotiation! These variants represent different aspects or factions within their societies — from Deep Unity to the Zeth-Charity Syndicate. The alternate versions may be freely intermixed with the originals, but both versions of a species may not be used in the same game.

This expansion features iconography and graphic design that match the Remastered Edition of Sidereal Confluence; however, since so few components in the game are randomized, you should be able to use it with the original edition without too much difficulty.

Name: 戦国ブリッジ (Sengoku Bridge)
Description:
In æˆ¦å›½ãƒ–ãƒªãƒƒã‚¸ (Sengoku Bridge), a trick-taking game, the players discard cards from an initial hand in order to draft special powers or conditions that will define the hand.  (Cards discarded are shuffled and redistributed so that players have the same number of cards in hand.)

Some powers allow a player to choose the trump suit, for instance.  Another power gives a player the Joker, the highest card in the game, which they can play regardless of if they could have followed suit.  Yet another power allows that player to never need to follow suit. There is another power that if a player can reveal a hand of cards that all share a suit, that suit immediately becomes trump.

Tricks are not worth any points, but collecting certain ranks is.  The player with the most points at the end of a hand is the winner.

Name: 戦国ブリッジ「群雄割拠」 (Sengoku Bridge: Gun'yū Kakkyo)
Trick or Treat: The Aftermath
Description:
Trick or Treat: The Aftermath is a game where you and your friends split up all the candy you collected on Halloween! Take turns dividing up your Halloween haul and claim the piles that will score you the most points! As you collect your favorite candies, you'll also gain bonuses and tricky abilities to help you get the tastiest mix at the end of the night!

This roll-and-write game uses an "I Split, You Choose" mechanic and takes around 15 minutes for 1-3 players to enjoy.

To setup, give everyone a scoresheet and a writing utensil. Then, pick one of the colors to be your "secret color" and write it on the back of the scoresheet. You will score this color twice during scoring. Now you are ready to roll!

Each round, one player will roll all six dice and divide them into a number of piles equal to the number of players. Then, starting with the next player, everyone will take a pile of dice, leaving the player who split them up to take the last pile. Everyone then writes the die values from their piles in their matching color column and then starts a new round.

The game ends when one player has completely filled two columns. All values are then added up, bonuses are counted, and the person with the most points wins!
Families: Organizations: Game Designers of North Carolina

Name: At The Height of Battle: The Battle of Fukuda Bay, October 1565
Description:
The Battle of Fukuda Bay is a scenario for At The Height of Battle in which a Japanese fleet engages a small Portuguese squadron over a matter of honour, in the first naval engagement between Japanese and European warships.

–Description from the publisher

Name: Richelieu
Description:
A French-language crossword card game published in Quebec.

Each player starts with 10 cards (or 7 if six people play), each with a letter on it. On your turn you play cards forming a word onto the table; after the first turn the word must fit with the others in a crossword fashion similar to Scrabble. Instead of playing a word, you may discard a card and draw from the deck or discard pile.

When someone plays all the cards from their hand, the other players add up the points remaining in their hand (5 points per consonant, 10 per vowel, 15 for the wild Richelieu card), and add it to their total.  When someone reaches an agreed-on total (e.g. 100 points), the player with the fewest points wins.

Name: Black Panthers: A Panzer Grenadier Book
Description:
Panzer Grenadier: Black Panthers tells the story of segregated African-American units that fought in World War II.

Black Panthers is a special expansion for Panzer Grenadier: Elsenborn Ridge. It has 24 new die-cut playing pieces for the Black Panthers under their distinctive insignia, and two dozen scenarios based on the epic battles of the 761st and other African-American units.

Most of the scenarios in the Black Panthers set feature the two battalions that served on the Western front alongside white divisions. The 758th Tank Battalion remained a light tank outfit, attached to the African-American 92nd Infantry Division in Italy. The 92nd did not have a very good war, thanks in large part to its spectacularly incompetent commander, Edward “Sic ’em Ned” Almond. They often fought against die-hard Italian Fascists, who of course aren’t included in Elsenborn Ridge (and have yet to appear at all in the Panzer Grenadier series), and in terrain very different from the wooded hills of the Ardennes. But the 761st and 784th provided plenty of action.

The nature of those battles is that of grinding, close-quarters combat, emphasizing combined arms cooperation.

Name: Skulls of Sedlec: Crown of Bones
Description:
Alone, you enter the ossuary. Your head bows instinctively before the Crown of Bones, a formidable relic of enduring construction. But that’s not all this hall holds. Altars, sconces, crucifixes: some of the most symbolic and resonant icons of bone occupy the room. You must find a way to replicate them all in order to consider yourself a true master. 

Crown of Bones builds on the solo play mode found in Monstrance, introducing 6 new Features to construct as well as 6 new scoring patterns to incorporate. Players will choose 1 of each randomly at setup to guide their gameplay. Crown of Bones is playable without Monstrance but the scoring condition side of the cards will require the skulls from the expansions. If you think you’ve mastered Skulls of Sedlec, step forward and claim your Crown.


Skulls of Sedlec: Crown of Bones is a 6-card expansion for Skulls of Sedlec, allowing for solo play.

This solo expansion celebrates these works of art by allowing you to create six unique features alongside a standard, pyramid-shaped stack of skulls. Each play session adds a condition that will make this undertaking a challenge for even the sharpest skull-stacker!

Name: ウルトリテン (Ultriten)
Description:
In ã‚¦ãƒ«ãƒˆãƒªãƒ†ãƒ³ (Ultriten), the players take part in a trick-taking game that features nature, buildings, monsters, and heroes.

Each player has a scoring area for each suit, and it starts as a pristine forest.  As things happen to each suit, cards may become "fallen", and their points will change.  For instance, a pristine forest is worth more points than one you've erected a building on. However, a monster that has been defeated by a hero will be worth more points.

The trick-taking phase is a must-follow round with no trump suit.  The winner takes all the cards from the trick and places them in their scoring areas.

After three rounds, the player with the most points wins.

Name: La Traversée
Description:
Your long and perilous journey home is almost over. Only one last obstacle stands between you and your destination: that wobbly suspension bridge, unstable and treacherous, especially when winter is approaching and the wind is blowing in icy, unpredictable gusts. One false step, one shift, and you could lose part of your precious cargo. Hunger and cold will also sap your strength.  And the night which is inevitably approaching will be your doom if it catches up with you before you have found refuge on dry land, on the other side of the bridge. Despite all these dangers, you set off and begin the crossing.

Each turn, players will program a few actions from their board (with action tokens) and resolve them. This will often involve moving forward along the bridge, revealing and resolving bridge cards and potentially weather cards. The game ends when the bridge is crossed or the night has caught up to the character or too much cargo has been lost along the way.

Name: Little Factory: Suburbs
Description:
Mini-extension of 4 cards to add to the game.

Rules:
Stockyard: Lets you exchange 1 Sheep with a 1 Cow, or vice versa.
Recycling Center : Lets you spend 1 Barrel to gain 1 Wood and 1 VP.
Supermaket: Lets you spend 1 or more Resource cards (of any level) to gain a single Level III resource card worth less than or equal to the value of the cards you spent.
Hardware Store: Lets you spend 1 Clay and 1 Wall to gain 3 VP.

Name: Wars of the Republic: Ancient Roman Wargaming 343–50 BC
Description:
From the First Samnite War and the eventual conquest of the Italian Peninsula, to the defeat by Hannibal at Lake Trasimene, and final victory over the Gauls at Alesia, Wars of the Republic is a miniature wargame that allows you to campaign with the legions or stand firm against Roman expansion and fight throughout the ancient Mediterranean. 
This book contains all the rules required to fight battles during this period, including multiple army lists to reflect the changing nature of the Roman military and the varied opponents they faced, be it Gaul, Italian, Carthaginian, Iberian, or Greek.

–Description from the publisher

Name: Tabriz: The Card Game
Description:
You are a skilled carpet weaver in the bustling Persian market city of Tabriz and your goal is to become the best known master of your craft. You accomplish this through savvy acquisitions from the market row and tactical completion of commoner, merchant, and royal commissions.

The heart of the Tabriz card game is the commission grid, an irregularly shaped series of resource requirement cards that form commissions in columns and rows. Complete a commission by dedicating the necessary resources for an entire column or row, removing those requirements from the grid and changing all connections commissions at the same time.

Commissions are defined by their length:


     3 cards is a common commission 
     4 cards is a merchant commission
     5 cards is a royal commission


Complete commissions with more cards for better rewards, including more coins and higher prestige. Merchant and royal commissions also earn you permanent abilities that contribute to your game engine.

On your turn, you take two actions. Actions include buying a Material card from the market row, trading a Material card you have for one in the market row, purging the market row, or taking 5 coins from the supply. At the end of each turn, if you have the necessary materials, you may complete 1 commission on the grid. You claim these Commission cards, changing the grid for future turns.

Earn the most prestige by the time the Commission deck runs out and you become the master weaver of Tabriz!

Name: The Portable Colonial Wargame
Description:
The rules have been designed to be used with a gridded tabletop made up of squares or hexes. 
This book has fourteen chapters, two sets of rules, two exemplar battle reports, two appendices, a list of sources of inspiration, and over one hundred and ten illustrations.

—description from the publisher

Name: Hit the Silk!: Extra Cargo Pack expansion
Description:
Additional content for Hit the Silk! 
- New Open Water expansion with Punchboard and addition rules.
- Deck of 20 Cards
- Altitude Dice
Limited Edition

Altitude Dice - this replaces the automatic 1000ft. drop in altitude after the vote to Hit the Silk! introducing variable outcomes between 500-1500 ft.
New Open Water Scenario including an additional game board (at the larger size). 
Deck of 20 Incident Cards - which can be added to any game and additional assets and rules specific to the scenario.

Name: Catastrophe
Description:
In Catastrophe, you and your friends prepare for an unforeseen disaster, securing resources and surviving the impacts to emerge alive together!

Players may be hit with any one of Catastrophe’s nine possible disasters. Can you survive an earthquake? What about a volcano or cyber attack? Maybe a radiological disaster will test your mettle. Strategize your way through seven potential emergency impacts with a wild card each round that will catch everyone by surprise. Will you hoard your resources or share with your neighbors?

The player who survives with the most vitality tokens will win, but be careful — if anyone perishes, the game is lost for all!

Name: Maracaibo: Founding Spirit Promo Card
Description:
Founding Spirit is a career card that was available as a promo at Spiel 2021 in Essen.

It gives you doubloons and points based on:
Quests
Victory Point Income
Number of bought cards

Name: Literówka
Description:
Literówka is a real-time game for 2-6 people in which players need to simultaneously write 6 words starting with letters shown on 6 rolled dices (consonants and/or vowels) according to drawn category. The first player to write down those words flips a 17-second timer. That player is now the fastest player, and every other player now has 17 seconds to write down their words.

When the timer runs out, players compare their lists of words and remove any words found by multiple players. Points are then awarded for remaining words: 1 point for each original word which moves a player's pawn on a score track. The track has 38 places and the first player who reaches the end of a scoring track is the winner.

Name: Autismo Autism Challenge
Description:
A board game that looks at emotions, life skills and moral dilemmas in a fun way.

Each player chooses a character and then they each take turns going around the board and answering either questions on certain cards or collecting baggage and skills cards each relating to emotions, life skills, social rules and moral dilemmas. A player can win the game if they have the most skills cards and the least baggage cards in a certain timespan.

Name: Skulls of Sedlec: Expansion Collection I
Description:
A wallet collection of three 6-card expansions for Skulls of Sedlec:


    Merchants
    Zealots
    Champions



Merchants want to be next to Peasants but avoid criminals.

Zealots want to have many Priests above or below them.

Champions want to be next to groups of their supporters.

Name: Chronicles of Avel: Adventurer's Toolkit
Description:
The monsters circling around Avel Castle, and especially the approaching Beast, are a real danger for the people of this land. It’s not surprising then that everyone wants to help with the battle. Craftsmen are crafting items, dwarves are building siege machines, and herbalists 
invent new recipes and boil potions. Even the wildness people will join the battle if you can prove your bravery by defeating monsters. Use their help and together protect Avel Castle!

Chronicles of Avel: Adventurer's Toolkit is an expansion that brings even more variety to your games! The characters created by you will get new, useful items and will have a chance to discover unknown corners of the land and all the possibilities they present. The expansion also introduces new monsters — if you manage to defeat them, you might be able to get the favor of animal companions who will gladly give you their helpful paws… or wings, if you need them.

Name: Chronicles of Avel: Hero's Treasures
Description:
Expand your Chronicles of Avel with 3 new, unique items. released at Essen 2021.

During setup add 3 new tokens in the equipment bag.

Name: Doppelkopf 2.0
Description:
You want to learn Doppelkopf? You have friends who finally want to learn Doppelkopf with you? You want to inspire your family for the exciting game? Then we now have the solution for you: Doppelkopf 2.0 - the classic game rethought.

Doppelkopf 2.0 - the classic game rethought are innovative Doppelkopf playing cards that enable beginners and infrequent players to grasp the logic and mechanics of the game more easily. The playing cards contain supplementary auxiliary information: the trump strengths and order, color coding and order of the missing cards, the value of the cards when counting them, and hints about the possibility of winning special victory points. And the nice thing: You can still play Doppelkopf according to the normal Doppelkopf rules. Our game is tested by the German Doppelkopf Association e.V. (DDV). You can add additional rules to the game, such as the "pig", by using the included additional cards.

For the pictures of the playing cards we have come up with something very special: As a graphical basis for the playing cards, we were able to get reproduction prints of two card decks from the 1930s from the German Playing Card Museum in Leinfelden: German Doppelkopf Card Game VASS Altenburg 1931 and a matching Dondorf's standard ladies' deck from the 1930s. We have taken the pictures from the historical playing cards, graphically enhanced them and put them together to a new beautiful set of playing cards.

Name: Similo: History – Bessie Coleman promo card
Description:
Promo card at Spiel '21. Was also available as part of the rewards for backing Game Boy Geek 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Bessie Coleman
Text: First African American women to become a licensed airplane pilot.

Name: Similo: History – Frederick Douglass promo card
Description:
Promo card at Spiel '21. Was also available as part of the rewards for backing Game Boy Geek 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Frederick Douglass
text: American orator, writer, statesman, and leader of the abolitionist movement.

Name: Tramways: Monaco / Chicago
Description: Tramways: Monaco / Chicago contains two new maps for use with Tramways.

Name: Die Abenteuer des Robin Hood: Die Intrige
Description:
With this adventure booklet, you can start another exciting adventure with Robin Hood and his companions. It takes place shortly before the 7th chapter. It introduces a new enemy for King Richard the Lionheart.

You should only play it if you have previously played “Die Treibjagd” or "The oath of 13". All outlaws already have their special skills.

This item was originally made available as a PDF, and later printed as part of Die Abenteuer des Robin Hood - Die Abenteuer Erweiterung.

Name: BattleTech: Inner Sphere Heavy Lance
Description:
Never the stars of the battlefield, these workhorses get the job done. Whether pulling garrison duty, anchoring a defensive operation, or providing support for a planetary invasion, these ‘Mechs never let their pilots down.

Unleash the Inner Sphere Heavy Lance on your enemies! Banshee, Grasshopper, Centurion, and Hatchetman—no assembly required—along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards.

Name: BattleTech: Clan Heavy Star
Description: The Clan Heavy Star is a collection of five plastic miniatures for use in the classic BattleTech tabletop and Alpha Strike games. The box also provides five dry-erase cards, which are intended to directly support Alpha Strike gameplay, and five new Clan Pilot Cards. The five BattleMechs available in the Clan Heavy Star are the Behemoth, Hunchback IIC, Marauder IIC, Supernova and Warhammer IIC.

Name: BattleTech: Inner Sphere Fire Lance
Description: The Inner Sphere Fire Lance is a collection of four plastic miniatures for use in the classic BattleTech tabletop and Alpha Strike games. The box also provides four dry-erase cards, which are intended to directly support Alpha Strike gameplay, and four new Clan Pilot Cards. Contains the Stalker, Zeus, Longbow and Trebuchet battlemechs.

Name: BattleTech: Clan Striker Star
Description: The Clan Striker Star is a collection of five plastic miniatures for use in the classic BattleTech tabletop and Alpha Strike games. The box also provides five dry-erase cards, which are intended to directly support Alpha Strike gameplay, and five new Clan Pilot Cards. The line-up of 'Mechs in this pack are the Conjurer, Horned Owl, Incubus, Piranha and Vapor Eagle.

Name: BattleTech: Clan Ad Hoc Star
Description: The Clan Ad Hoc Star is a collection of five plastic miniatures for use in the classic BattleTech tabletop and Alpha Strike games. The box also provides five dry-erase cards, which are intended to directly support Alpha Strike gameplay, and five new Clan Pilot Cards. The five 'Mechs available in the star pack are the Fire Falcon, Hellion, Howler, Kodiak and Pack Hunter.

Name: BattleTech: Inner Sphere Urban Lance
Description: The Inner Sphere Urban Lance is a collection of four plastic miniatures for use in the classic BattleTech tabletop and Alpha Strike games. The box also provides four dry-erase cards, which are intended to directly support Alpha Strike gameplay, and four new Clan Pilot Cards.  The four 'Mechs available in the lance pack are the Enforcer, Hunchback, Raven and Victor.

Name: BattleTech: Inner Sphere Support Lance
Description: The Inner Sphere Support Lance is a collection of four plastic miniatures for use in the classic BattleTech tabletop and Alpha Strike games. The box also provides four dry-erase cards, which are intended to directly support Alpha Strike gameplay, and four new Clan Pilot Cards. The four 'Mechs available in the lance pack are the Cyclops, Dragon, Spider and Thug.

Name: BattleTech: Clan Elemental Star
Description: The Clan Elemental Star is a collection of five plastic miniatures for use in the classic BattleTech tabletop and Alpha Strike games.

Name: BattleTech: ComStar Command Level II
Description: The ComStar Command Level II is a collection of six plastic miniatures for use in the classic BattleTech tabletop and Alpha Strike games. The box also provides six dry-erase cards, which are intended to directly support Alpha Strike gameplay, and six new Pilot Cards.  The six 'Mechs available in this pack are the Black Knight, Exterminator, Highlander, King Crab, Mercury and Sentinel.

Name: Cloud of Witnesses: Bible Character Card Game
Description:
The object of the game is to match quotations to the person from the Bible, on character cards, the first player to match all of their character cards is the winner.

Each player starts with seven character cards, on their turn, they draw a quote card and (if they can) they play the appropriate character card from their hand, if they are wrong they draw a new character card.

The game ends when one player has played all of their character cards, and that player is the winner.

Name: BattleTech: ComStar Battle Level II
Description: The ComStar Battle Level II is a collection of six plastic miniatures for use in the classic BattleTech tabletop and Alpha Strike games. The box also provides four dry-erase cards, which are intended to directly support Alpha Strike gameplay, and four new Clan Pilot Cards. The six 'Mechs available in the lance pack are the Crab, Crockett, Flashman, Guillotine, Lancelot and Mongoose.

Name: Ja Ci pokażę
Description:
Ja ci pokaÅ¼Ä™ is a charades-based party game for teams of two or more players. It contains cards featuring famous historical or fictional characters, items, sentences, names of food and drinks.  Players take cards and shuffle them to form a deck, and this deck is used for the game.

In each round, one of a team members take turns trying to get their teammates to guess as many words from the cards as possible in 60 seconds.

There is way of showing in one side of the card and word on the other side of the card. One player turns around top card and has to show or tell the word in a special way (i.e. only by hands and no words or by using only words starting on K,P or S). If the team guesses they get the card as a point. If nobody can´t guess the word and time is up, next team plays.
If the preprepared deck runs out the team with the most points is the winner.

—description from the publisher

Name: BattleTech: Legendary MechWarriors Pack
Description:
The Legendary MechWarriors Pack is a collection of four plastic miniatures for use in the classic BattleTech tabletop and Alpha Strike games. The box also provides four dry-erase cards, which are intended to directly support Alpha Strike gameplay, and four new Pilot Cards.

The four 'Mechs available in the lance pack are unique sculpts:

• Morgan Kell's Archer
• Natasha Kerensky's Dire Wolf
• Grayson "Death" Carlyle's Marauder
• Aidan Pryde's Timber Wolf

The Legendary MechWarriors pack was a Kickstarter exclusive available during the Clan Invasion Kickstarter.

Name: Star Scrappers: Cave-in – Legendary Mercenaries
Description:
Six legendary mercenary cards and six supporting information cards for the Cave-In game from the Star Scrappers: Orbital Kickstarter.

The six legendary mercenaries are:
- Hy'dran What'err
- Metanel Adjunkt
- Terron Quartermaster
- Mineggler Harmonyx
- Weedlock Fertilizer
- Bioss Dominatrix

Name: Senjutsu: Battle For Japan – The Ghost in the Night
Description:
This add-on consists of a Ninja miniature with ability cards and a solo deck.

The Ninja or Concealed Warrior, is quick and deadly. Armed with the Kusarigama, a chained flail and sickle, he moves with the environment as his ally.

His unique Ability Cards feature tracks, secret weapons and smoke bombs. Use these unusual cards to escape from tight spots on the battlefield and fight on. However, beware long combats! The Ninja suffers when exposed to the light of day.
Families: Series: The Battle For Japan (Stone Sword Games)

Name: Shuffle Game & Speed Hockey
Description:
Double sided wooden board offers two different games, both based on slinging your pieces with elastic band.

In Shuffle Game players try to move their pieces around a path and land their pieces in a scoring area to get most points. Scoring area is divided in five parts, each giving different amount of points. If a piece lands in "Out" area it scores 0 points. Not being able to land in scoring area results in negative points.

In Speed Hockey players shoot their pieces through small slot in the middle of the playing field. The first player to bring all pieces onto opponent´s side wins the game.

Name: Senjutsu: Battle For Japan – The Gathering Storm
Description:
Comes with two 32mm miniatures (Sohei Monk and Dutch Sailor) and 104 ability cards including each character's signature cards, kamae trees, new base ability cards and their own unique solo decks.

The Monk is a powerful fighter to play, with a great Weapon Card, 'Jumonji Yari Stab'. A backwards 1 optional movement, solid attack pattern and then a Focus-spend to move into the Defensive (Yellow) Kamae position means that the Monk is rarely flanked!

The Sailor is our homage to William Adams, an English Pilot who washed up onto the shore of Japan in the 16th century and incredibly rose up the ranks to become a full Samurai!

His Core Card's Special Ability allows you to swap out the Pistol for his Carrack Sword, whilst the Pistol is out you may use it to take the "Dreaded Shot" Gold Attack Ability Card or must defend yourself by using it as a rudimentary club!
Families: Series: The Battle For Japan (Stone Sword Games)

Name: BINGO13
Description:
BINGO13 is a roll-and-write game where the first person to complete 4 "bingos" will win.

On a turn, the active player rolls 4 dice.  If 3 or 4 of the dice can sum to 13, one set of options is triggered.  Otherwise, a second set.  The other players will also make a mark on each turn, and the type will depend upon if 13 is possible.

Players can earn "items" that let them adjust future die rolls when they fill in certain boxes or don't have a legal place to mark.

Name: Chorizo
Description:
In many societies of the world there is corruption with its different popular sayings "bite, bribery, CHORIZO, etc."
The Chorizo â€‹â€‹game is designed to show some forms of corruption that exist in the world.

The purpose of the game is to understand what corruption is, how to avoid it and teach players to avoid this evil. Say no to corruption, say yes to Chorizo â€‹â€‹game!

The game its similar to monopoly or petrodollars, with few differences where you have to go through elections to became president You roll a dice, move around the board and instead of buying properties, you buy corrupt politicians (judges, deputies, transit police, etc) The idea is that you try to be president as many times as possible to accumulate money buying, selling or exchanging properties

The game ends when with one of the following situations:
1) when all the players became elected president at least one time, then finish the last round until next elections
2) setting up a time limit at the beginning of the game

The player who collects the most money wins

The goal is for each player to be president as many times as possible and accumulate the most money.


En muchas sociedades del mundo existe la corrupción con sus diferentes dichos populares "mordida, soborno, CHORIZO, etc."
El juego chorizo esta diseñado para mostrar unas formas de corrupción que hay en el mundo.
la finalidad del juego es el entender que es la corrupción, como evitarla y enseñar a los jugadores a evitar este mal. !Di no a la corrupción, di si al juego chorizo!

Name: Lobotomy: Essen 2021  promo set
Description:
Labotomy II: manhunt - 2021 Essen Promo

3 character cards and associated minis.

Misty Fowler
Bardock Brofist
Greta o'Connor

Name: Federation & Empire: Tactical Operations
Description:
To Heck with Logistics! Tactics for the Win!

Tactical Operations has more rules for Federation & Empire with all the crunchiness that you’ve come to expect. 
There are X-maulers, war cruiser leaders and war destroyer leaders, light gunboat tenders, and stellar fortresses. There are more shipyard functions to provide efficient ways to manage your construction schedule. And there are flexible command points to aid admirals.
 The War that Almost Was explores a “what if” conflict between the Gorns and the Federation after a brash young captain first encountered the Gorns. Eye of the Storm explores what would have happened if everyone (and we mean everyone!) ganged up on a rich Federation. Firestorm is an alternative history scenario for five players, which assumes the Hydran Expedition got through to the Federation. You know you always wanted to invade the WYN Cluster, and Into the Whirlpool lets you do exactly that. There are also alternative starts to the General War.

You will need the Federation & Empire 2010 Rulebook and various countersheets to use this expansion.

description from the publisher

Name: Save Bruno Maciel
Description:
Based on a real story taken place in Viana Con 2021, "Save Bruno Maciel" is a semi-cooperative push your luck game where players need to save Bruno Maciel from choking but... they get points from stealing his beef! It's a run against time.

In each round, players roll dice and choose between raising the bar of Bruno's life or getting a piece of his steak. When a player chooses to collect a piece of steak, the life bar of Bruno is decreased and the consequences are unpredictable.

Players can also choose to assist Bruno raising his life bar, getting special abilities for that.

The game is over when the dice clock expires.

Name: Fore's Wild
Description:
Golfers pair strategy and luck to go for the course record! Rolling through beautiful courses, players must decide whether to lay up and play it safe or roll the dice and attack a tight pin location.

The odds may be on your side, but will the dice be?

Fore's Wild is the most realistic golf tabletop game on the market, leaving you either ecstatic or infuriated.

Play a fast 18 holes solo or create a winner-take-all group tournament, it's all up to you! Take aim, roll your shot... FORE!

Name: Monopoly: Marvel Universe
Description:
Play Monopoly with the greatest heroes and villains from the Marvel Universe! X-Men, Avengers, Fantastic Four; all famous Marvel characters are there. Play the game with one of six exclusive playing pieces, such as Sabretooth, Hawkeye of Captain America.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Senjutsu: Battle For Japan – The Shadow Under Steel
Description:
Comes with three 32mm miniatures (Ashigaru, Akita, and Ninja Assassin) and 104 ability cards including each character's signature cards, kamae trees, new base ability cards and their own unique solo decks.

The Ashigaru and his Akita guard dog have a unique dynamic on the battlefield, where the controlling Player must make sure their lowly Ashigaru works in tandem with the powerful Akita to bring down your enemies. Neither the Ashigaru or the dog are strong in isolation- with each having fewer wounds than a regular fighter and less spectacular feats of endurance, skill and strength reflected in their Signature Cards. Combined however, you have a potent team that will leave any opponent desperately defending themselves against tooth and spearpoint!

The Akita is represented by a single Behaviour Card and deck of Ability Cards, whilst the Ashigaru is controlled like a regular fighter- through a 40 card Ability Card Deck and Kamae Tree.

The Assassin is our high damage-output, high vulnerability fighter. With a fantastic system for Focus generation on the Kamae Tree and a Focus-gaining special ability on the Core Card, the Assassin specialises on doing as much as he can quickly and then escaping to safety.
Families: Series: The Battle For Japan (Stone Sword Games)

Name: Biblemoji
Description:
Biblemoji is a fun and easy Christian game to play, connect, laugh, and talk about some main characters of the Bible, illustrated in emojis.

This game has more or less the same concept as the classic game of 7 Families, but with a few twists. 
There are 8 characters, so 8 families of 5 cards. Each family is a collection of 5 clues to guess the character of the Bible.

Gather 5 cards of the same family to complete a character of the Bible; gather the most families and you win the game! Ask strategically the cards you need. Observe the moves of other players to sabotage their game. Trick others (or yourself!) with the tricky-cards that may (or may not!) be in your favor!

This game is ideal for families and groups interested in the Christian faith, to have a fun time as well as learning opportunities about the Bible.

—description from the designer

Name: Auksinis protas: Didysis stalo žaidimas
Description:
"Golden mind. The Great Board Game" is a team intelligence game. His goal is to advance three playoff rounds and face the strongest opponent in the final. The first two rounds are in teams, the third and final are for personal mind battles. The game has as many as 1300 questions from wildlife, history, inventions, culture, astronomy and so on. Joker cards give the game excitement, surprise and fun, from which the TV game hosts - ArÅ«nas Valinskas and Andrius Tapinas - give the tasks to the players after reading the QR codes with your phone.

"Golden mind. The Great Board Game" can be supplemented with cards from the games "Golden Mind. Start No. 1" and "Golden Mind. Start No. 2".


„Auksinis protas. Didysis stalo Å¾aidimas“ – komandinis intelektinis Å¾aidimas. Jo tikslas – pereiti tris atkrentamuosius turus ir finale susikauti su stipriausiu varÅ¾ovu. Pirmieji du turai – komandiniai, treÄiasis ir finalas skirti asmeninÄ—ms proto kovoms. Å½aidime net 1300 klausimÅ³ iš gyvosios gamtos, istorijos, išradimÅ³, kultÅ«ros, astronomijos ir pan. sriÄiÅ³. Azarto, netikÄ—tumo ir smagaus juoko Å¾aidimui suteikia dÅ¾okerio kortelÄ—s, nuo kuriÅ³ nuskaiÄius QR kodus uÅ¾duotis Å¾aidÄ—jams pateikia patys TV Å¾aidimo vedÄ—jai – ArÅ«nas Valinskas ir Andrius Tapinas.

„Auksinis protas. Didysis stalo Å¾aidimas“ galima papildyti kortelÄ—mis iš Å¾aidimÅ³ „Auksinis protas. Startas Nr. 1“ ir „Auksinis protas. Startas Nr. 2“.

Name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #71 – Royal Italian Army
Description:
In the division of alliances of World War II which saw nations join with the Allies or the Axis, the Italian army found itself on opposing sides as the war progressed. Face the brunt of the Commonwealth 8th Army in North Africa, defend Sicily from the onslaught of the Allies, or fight to liberate Italy from the German occupiers.

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Mediterranean game, including new Italian Soldiers and Light Vehicle, Italian Hostiles, Gear and Service Record Cards. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

4 Italian Player Soldiers
3 Italian Non-Player Soldiers
3 Italian Squad Soldiers
1 Italian Squad Light Vehicle
1 Skill
11 Weapons and Gear
3 Service Record Cards
30 Italian Hostiles

Name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #75 – Operation Tombola
Description:
Operation Tombola was a British SAS-led mission to carry out a series of harrassing raids behind enemy lines in the Reggio Emilia region, at the top of the Italian "boot". The operation was put together by Major Roy Farrar, who was not allowed to go on the actual mission, although he was allowed to accompany the SAS on the aircraft as they were airdropped. During the airdrop, he "accidentally" fell out of the aircraft, although he happened to have a parachute on, and was able to lead his troops in the field.

The attacks included an assault on the German Gebirgs (mountain corps) headquarters in an attempt to decapitate their regional high command. Notably, a Scottish piper was part of the assaulting force, so that the friendlies could identify which side they were fighting on, as well as to confuse the Germans into thinking that a main Allied force was attacking rather than a raiding party.

This battlepack adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Mediterranean game, including new Airborne SAS Soldiers, German Alpine Hostiles, Missions, Objectives, Location, Landing Zone, and Enemy Lines cards. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

4 SAS Player Soldiers
3 SAS Non-Player Soldiers
3 SAS Squad Soldiers
4 Missions
4 Objectives
1 Location
4 Landing Zone
9 Enemy Lines
1 Skill
6 Weapons and Gear (including Bagpipes)
17 German Alpine Hostiles

Player's Note: This set is intended to be played using the Warfighter Mediterranean core set, including Locations. There is a Tombola Location card "Villa Calvi" in the set, which is a requisite for one of the Objective cards "Villa Rossi", and can be omitted for the other Tombola Objectives. 

If you are playing the "Villa Rossi" Objective, add the "Villa Calvi" card into the Location card deck and draw Locations as normal. Although the Tombola Location card back is a giveaway, treat this as the effect that the squad has a pathway to the Villa Calvi, as a prelude to attacking the Villa Rossi.

Name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #76 – Battle of Crete #1
Description:
The Battle of Crete marks the occasion in which the German Fallschirmjäger (paratroops) executed the first major airborne invasion in warfare, only to be faced by stiff resistance from Allied forces, bolstered by Cretan civilians who also took up arms against the invaders. Initial fighting from the defenders was so fierce that the German offensive briefly faltered, before Allied hesitation allowed the Germans to rally and regain the initiative, forcing the Allies to retreat and eventually capitulate. The success of the airborne operation demonstrated the mobility and capabilities of airborne assault forces.

This battlepack adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Mediterranean game, including New Zealander Soldiers, German Hostiles, Missions, Objectives, Locations, Skills and Gear cards. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

3 NZ Player Soldiers
3 NZ Non-Player Soldiers
3 NZ Squad Soldiers
4 Missions
5 Objectives
13 Locations
4 Weapons
2 Skills
19 German Hostiles + Events

Name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #77 – Battle of Crete #2
Description:
The Battle of Crete marks the occasion in which the German Fallschirmjäger (paratroops) executed the first major airborne invasion in warfare, only to be faced by stiff resistance from Allied forces, bolstered by Cretan civilians who also took up arms against the invaders. Initial fighting from the defenders was so fierce that the German offensive briefly faltered, before Allied hesitation allowed the Germans to rally and regain the initiative, forcing the Allies to retreat and eventually capitulate. The success of the airborne operation demonstrated the mobility and capabilities of airborne assault forces.

This battlepack adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Mediterranean game, including new German Airborne Soldiers, British Hostiles, Missions, Objectives, Location, Landing Zone, and Enemy Lines cards. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

3 German Airborne Player Soldiers
3 German Airborne Non-Player Soldiers
3 German Airborne Squad Soldiers
5 Missions
6 Objectives
11 Locations
3 Landing Zone
9 Enemy Lines
8 Weapons
2 Skills
3 British Hostiles + Events

Name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #78 – Battle of Rimini
Description:
The Battle of Rimini was part of Operation Olive, the Allied offensive against the Gothic Line in Northern Italy. The township of Rimini, situated along the Adriatic coast, was the easternmost anchor point of the Rimini Line, which was part of the multi-layered wall of Gothic Line defenses. The battle for the town along its outlying regions and into the town itself was some of the most brutal fighting, given the strategic significance of the city. At the conclusion of hostilities, it was estimated that less than 2% of the buildings in the city had been unscathed by the fighting.

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Mediterranean game, including new Greek Mountain Infantry Soldiers, German Hostiles, Missions, Locations, Objectives, Skills, Gear and Situation Cards. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

4 Greek Mountain Infantry Player Soldiers
3 Greek Mountain Infantry Non-Player Soldiers
3 Greek Mountain Infantry Squad Soldiers
4 Missions
4 Objectives
12 Locations
5 Weapons
2 Skills
17 German Hostiles
2 Situation

Name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #79 – Fortifications – Gothic Line
Description:
The Gothic Line was a major German strategic defensive line along northern Italy, and its final line of defense used by the retreating German forces in Italy in the late stages of the war, with over a million soldiers combined in the British 8th Army and American 5th Army facing the German 10th and 14th Armies. The Gothic Line itself was a series of multi-layered defensive emplacements, built using captured and slave labour, including machine gun nests, casemates, bunkers, observation posts and artillery emplacements. The campaign to decisively breach the Gothic Line took over ten months of Allied efforts (although it had been briefly breached during the Battle of Rimini).

This set adds 56 Fortification cards to your Warfighter WWII Mediterranean game, including new Fortificaion Objectives, Fortifications, Hostiles, Skills and Gear. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

6 Fortification Objectives
22 Fortifications
5 Skills
3 Gear
20 German Alpine Hostiles + Events

Name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #80 – Italian Partisans
Description:
After the tide had turned against the Axis and civil war broke out in Italy following the Armistice of Cassibile in 1943, brave civilians began their insurrection and arose against the tyranny of the former fascist government forces and German invaders. In much chaos and confusion, often battling on several fronts, the Italian civilian resistance groups bravely took the fight to their enemies, ambushing and harassing them, whilst using their local knowledge to full advantage to evade and escape after making their attacks, supported by the local populace.

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Mediterranean game, including new Italian Partisans (Soldiers), National Republic Army Hostiles, Missions, Objectives, Locations, Skills and Weapons. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

4 Italian Partisan Player Soldiers
3 Italian Partisan Non-Player Soldiers
3 Italian Partisan Squad Soldiers
4 Missions
4 Objectives
12 Locations
2 Weapons
2 Skills
18 National Republican Army Hostiles 
4 Events

Name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #81 – Italian Airborne "Folgore"
Description:
Incepted and formed just before the onset of World War II, the Italian Paratrooper Brigade "Folgore" saw extensive action throughout the Mediterranean basin, whether it was fighting in North Africa, reinforing the Aegean islands or defending mainland Italy, and establishing a formidable reputation for itself.

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Mediterranean game, including new Italian Airborne Soldiers, Missions, Landing Zone, Enemy Lines, Skills, Gear and Service Record Cards. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

5 Italian "Folgore" Airborne Player Soldiers
5 Italian "Folgore" Airborne Non-Player Soldiers
5 Italian "Folgore" Airborne Squad Soldiers
6 Airborne Missions
6 Landing Zone
12 Enemy Lines
5 Skills
3 Weapons
6 Gear
3 Service Record Cards

Name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #83 – Savoia Cavalleria
Description:
The Charge of the Savoia Cavalleria at Izbushensky Khutor (hamlet) in the Volga Region was a skirmish between the Italian Cavalry 3rd Regiment "Savoia Cavalleria" and the Soviet 812th Siberian Infantry Regiment in August 1942. Although it was a minor encounter in the larger Eastern Theatre of Operations, the Charge of the Savoia Cavelleria has historical significance as one of the final major cavalry charges in armed warfare, and its actions resonated with much propaganda throughout Italy.

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Mediterranean game, including new Italian Soldiers, Soviet Hostiles, Missions, Locations, Objectives, Skills, Weapons and Equipment. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

3 Italian Calvary Player Soldiers
3 Italian Calvary Non-Player Soldiers
2 Italian Calvary Squad Soldiers
4 Missions
4 Objectives
12 Locations
3 Weapons 
3 Gear
2 Skills
18 Soviet Hostiles
2 Events

Name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #86 – Vehicles: Italian Army
Description:
As the nations continued the arms race leading up to World War II, even the Italian army had realized the need for armoured fighting vehicles in its inventory, and their national factories were ready to respond with numerous designs in the emerging requirements of modern armoured warfare. These included the Carro Armato M13 medium tank and its variants, the Carro Armato L6 light tank, the Semovente 47 self-propelled artillery, the Carro Veloce L3 tankette as well as various armoured cars.

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Mediterranean game, including new Italian Squad Vehicles, Anti-Vehicle Hostiles, Action, Driving and Skills cards. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

6 Action
3 Skills
7 Driving
1 Location Marker
16 Italian Squad Vehicles
23 Italian Anti-Vehicle Hostiles

Name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #69 – Long Range Desert Group
Description:
The Long Range Desert Group was a special forces troop which specialist in desert combat, waging unconventional warfare against Axis forces across the vast deserts of North Africa, executing highly mobile operations covering vast distances. The harsh, unyielding climate was itself as treacherous as the enemy.

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII North Africa game, including new UK Soldiers and Squad Vehicles, German Anti-Vehicle Hostiles, Missions, Locations, Objectives, Gear, Skills and Driving cards. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

3 Player Soldiers
3 Non-Player Soldiers 
2 Squad Soldiers
3 Squad Vehicles
3 Gear
2 Driving
2 Skills
3 Missions
4 Objectives
12 Locations
17 Anti-Vehicle Hostiles 
2 Events

Name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #70 – Afrika Korps
Description:
Created and sent across the sea to reinforce their Italian allies against the juggernaut of the Allied Commonwealth forces in North Africa, the Deutsches Afrika Korps under the leadership of their inspirational commander Erwin Rommel fought in some of the fiercest campaigns in World War II in Libya and Egypt, and were both feared and respected by their opponents.

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII North Africa game, including new German Afrika Korps Soldiers and Hostiles, Light Vehicle, Gear, Weapons, Skills and Service Record cards. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

4 Player Soldiers
4 Non-Player Soldiers
3 Squad Soldiers
1 Squad Light Vehicle
1 Skill
10 Weapons
2 Gear
3 Service Record Cards
28 Hostiles

Name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #72 – Battle of Bardia
Description:
The Battle of Bardia was one of the first Allied incursions into North Africa as part of Operation Compass, with the Australian 6th Division assaulting the fiercely-defended fortress and township of Bardia. It was a hard fought victory with over 30000 enemy prisoners taken, and opened the path for the Allied campaign to advance into Libya and Cyrenaica.

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII North Africa game, including:

4 Australian Player Soldiers
4 Australian Non-Player Soldiers
4 Australian Squad Soldiers
3 Missions
4 Objectives
12 Locations
6 Weapons
1 Gear
1 Skill
15 Hostiles + 2 Events

Name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #73 – Battle of Bir Hakeim
Description:
The Battle of Bir Hakeim and the delays which it caused to the Axis offensive contributed to the cancellation of Operation Herkules, the invasion of Malta. The Free French forces fiercely defended the oasis known as Bir Hakeim against a superior marauding Panzerarmee force, taking heavy casualties, but in turn became a moral and propaganda victory in its own right, proving the effectiveness of the French forces.

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII North Africa game, including new Free French Soldiers and Squad Vehicle, Germnan Hostiles, Missions, Locations, Objectives, Gear and Skills cards. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

4 French Player Soldiers
4 French Non-Player Soldiers
4 French Squad Soldiers
1 Squad Vehicle
11 Weapons and Gear
4 Skills
6 Missions
5 Objectives
14 Locations
3 German Hostiles + Events

Name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #74 – Battle of Damascus
Description:
The Battle of Damascus was one of the final actions of the Syrian-Lebanon Campaign, with Free French troops, along with British Indian and Australian allies, in a final push to capture the capital city of Syria. The advancing forces captured the outlying towns at Qadim and Merdjayoun, relieving the siege of Mezzeh, before advancing on Damascus and eventually forcing the surrender of the Vichy French garrison in the city.

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII North Africa game, including new French Soldiers, Vichy Hostiles, Missions, Locations, Objectives, Gear and Skills cards. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

4 French Player Soldiers
3 French Non-Player Soldiers
3 French Squad Soldiers
6 Weapons and Gear
4 Missions
4 Objectives
14 Locations
18 Vichy French Hostiles + Events

Name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #84 – Vehicles: Afrika Korps
Description:
Created and sent across the sea to reinforce their Italian allies against the juggernaut of the Allied Commonwealth forces in North Africa, the Deutsches Afrika Korps under the leadership of their inspirational commander Erwin Rommel fought in some of the fiercest campaigns in World War II in Libya and Egypt, and were both feared and respected by their opponents.

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII North Africa game, including new German Vehicles, German Anti-Vehicle Hostiles, Action, Driving and Skills cards. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

6 Action
4 Skills + Gear
5 Driving
1 Location Marker
18 German Squad Vehicles
22 German Anti-Vehicle Hostiles

Name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #85 – Vehicles: Desert Rats
Description:
The evocative nickname "Desert Rats" originated from the 7th Armoured Division, but later expanded to include all the Commonwealth troops - British, Australian, Indian and New Zealand - who fought and distinguished themselves in North Africa. This pack covers the fighting vehicles used by the Desert Rats, as well as featuring the same forces in an adversarial role.

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII North Africa game, including new UK Vehicles, UK Anti-Vehicle Hostiles, Action, Driving and Skills cards. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

6 Action
3 Skills
7 Driving
1 Location Marker
16 UK Squad Vehicles
23 UK Anti-Vehicle Hostiles

Name: Warfighter: WWII Expansion #82 – Raid on Saint-Nazaire
Description:
The raid on the French Atlantic coastal town of Saint-Nazaire, Operation Chariot, is one of the most audacious operations in the history of warfare. The obsolete destroyer HMS Campbeltown was disguised to resemble a German vessel and rammed the Normandie dry dock gates, blowing it up and putting it out of service until after the war.  At the same time, a force of Royal Marines Commandos landed in the town to attack the harbour facilities and other infrastructure, whilst sowing havoc and reaping chaos amongst the enemy garrison. As most of the transports for extraction were destroyed or immobilized, many of the raiding Commando force were killed or captured when their ammunition ran out.

This set adds 56 cards to your Warfighter WWII Europe game, including new Royal Marines Commandos Soldiers, Embedded German Hostiles, Missions, Objectives, Locations, Gear and Skills cards. This expansion offers 56 cards including:

5 Royal Marine Commando Player Soldiers
4 Royal Marine Commando Non-Player Soldiers
5 Royal Marine Commando Squad Soldiers
6 Missions
7 Objectives
14 Locations
1 Skill
9 Weapons + Gear
3 Hostiles
2 Situation

Name: Kind of a Drag: Operation Durango/Frisco City, April 1967
Description:
After a year-and-a-half of being “in country”, the US Joint Chiefs of Staff and many in the Pentagon were becoming increasingly concerned that the war in South Vietnam was not going according to plan. Despite increasingly optimistic reports and news conferences from the head of MACV, Military Assistance Command, Vietnam, General William Westmoreland, the Viet Cong insurgency against the South Vietnamese government, although bloodied and beaten in several major engagements, was still dangerous and growing thanks to increasing aid from Communist North Vietnam.

General Westmoreland put forward in the Fall of 1966 a bold plan to invade the southern “pan handle” of North Vietnam as well as neighboring areas of Laos through which the Communist’s supply line (dubbed the “Ho Chi Minh Trail”) ran. The plan was to take and hold these areas to interdict the Communist’s support to the South, as well as compel the NVA (North Vietnamese Army) to do battle in the open against the US and ARVN (Army of the Republic of Vietnam) to take back their occupied homeland and supply lines. General Westmoreland reasoned this was a fight the enemy could not avoid, and one we could not lose. The cost to conduct the planned invasion was for another 206,000 men (six additional divisions plus support personnel) to be deployed to the region. This would dangerously deplete the US military’s strategic reserve, as well as escalating the conflict to the point of risking global war with China and the Soviet Union. Would this plan have worked in bringing about a military solution to the Vietnam War, or would it have just “widened the stage” of this tragic quagmire for the US?

Can you do as well or better than your historical counterparts? Learn and enjoy!

Players will need a standard deck of playing cards including both Joker cards, a D6, and one D10 to play the game. A custom card set, that replaces the standard deck of playing cards is available from the publisher.

Each turn represents 3 or 4 days of time. A hex is about ten miles across. Combat units are either battalions (II) or companies (I). Kind of a Drag is designed by Paul Rohrbaugh and features graphics by Ilya Kudriashov.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Strandgut
Description:
A tile placing game.

To win in competition mode, you've got to place a tile adjacent to the tile where the wanderer stands, then decide to move the wanderer to one of the new tiles or let him stay. This way you can choose to move it where the next player can't take a turn.

To win cooparative, you got to lay down all tile in game (move the wandere to where the next player can place a tile).

The rules are pretty simple but nice with children so they learn to plan forward (or learn playing at all).

Name: Hatsumode
Description:
The purpose of the game is to travel to the seven Jinja locations spaced out along the map of Japan, and meet the requirements for each location to receive the Takaramono treasures.  Each player starts the game at the Toyama Bay location on the west coast, and they start each turn by drawing enough cards to have a four Goshintai-card hand.  The collecting of Takaramono - and the amount each player possesses - will affect this total later in the game.

In order to move around the board, the player must use the movement choices listed on the Goshintai cards to travel in the direction of the choice.  The action that the player takes after moving is determined by the color of the space they land on.

When you encounter a Yokai, they will either fight you, curse you, or help you, depending on the symbol in the upper-left corner:  combat-oriented Yokai feature a black symbol, and effect-oriented Yokai feature a red symbol. When you reach a Jinja, you have the option of trading in the combat-oriented Yokai that you defeated for the Takaramono at that temple.

Once you have collected all seven Takaramono, you must return to the initial starting location at Toyama Bay.  The first player to reach Toyama Bay with all seven Takaramono is the winner.

Name: 1-2 Punch
Description:
A highly strategic boxing game for 2 players. Predict your opponent's moves to get the KO!

1-2 Punch is an easy-to-learn strategic boxing card game that is easy to learn, but difficult to master. Similar to other abstract strategy games, 1-2 Punch rewards experienced players as they continue to play and hone their skills.

Both players strategically play two cards per round; one for their first action and another for their second action. Reveal and resolve the cards played for each action based on timings shown on each card. Execute your plan to land the perfect punch to exhaust your opponent and break their guard.

With only 24 cards and no board, 1-2 Punch can be played anywhere!

Name: Dating Queen
Description: Go to the movies with Andreas or to a candlelight dinner with Tobias? Who can collect the most dates? Each playing girl must try to find the most suitable date with her date cards and thus snag the boy. But whether the date takes place at all or unexpected problems arise is decided by the dice. Whoever has collected the most plus points in dating wins the game.

Name: Deamon Dice: Blood Booster Pack
Description:
Each Daemon Dice Booster provides a new breed of fiendish gladiators to send into the Infernal Arena. New Purebreed abilities can change the tide of battle. Any breeds can be combined to create new combinations to ensure your minion is the last one standing (or at least squirming).

Blood daemon (red plastic/black ink): A blood daemon doesn't just enjoy seeing arterial spray; they sustain themselves by drinking it! Each attack/ability that causes a body part to be wounded recovers a stunned body part after all the victims’ damage has been suffered. Note: This is in addition to anything recovered via a Mouth.

Each Daemon Dice Booster pack contains a random assortment of 13 18mm 6-sided dice of one breed of daemon (the breed is indicated on the sticker on the front of the box). Collect more boosters from a single breed to enhance the power of those daemons, or combine different booster packs to create hellish new varieties to send into the arena to fight for you.

—description from the publisher

Name: Deamon Dice: Death Booster Pack
Description:
Each Daemon Dice Booster provides a new breed of fiendish gladiators to send into the Infernal Arena. New Purebreed abilities can change the tide of battle. Any breeds can be combined to create new combinations to ensure your minion is the last one standing (or at least squirming).

Death Daemon (Black plastic/yellow ink):Death claims all things in the end, one just needs eternal patience to be victorious! During each turn, a death daemon generates an automatic targeted minus. During your foe’s next turn, apply this minus to your choice of the foe's dice prior to the non-targeted minuses!

Each Daemon Dice Booster pack contains a random assortment of 13 18mm 6-sided dice of one breed of daemon (the breed is indicated on the sticker on the front of the box). Collect more boosters from a single breed to enhance the power of those daemons, or combine different booster packs to create hellish new varieties to send into the arena to fight for you.

—description from the publisher

Name: Deamon Dice: Fester Booster Pack
Description:
Each Daemon Dice Booster provides a new breed of fiendish gladiators to send into the Infernal Arena. New Purebreed abilities can change the tide of battle. Any breeds can be combined to create new combinations to ensure your minion is the last one standing (or at least squirming).

Fester daemon (yellow plastic/red ink): Fester daemons are covered in blisters so swollen with vile pus that they burst when wounded! Each attack/ability that causes a body part to be wounded inflicts a stun damage against the attacker which is taken immediately after all the fester daemon’s damage has been suffered.

Each Daemon Dice Booster pack contains a random assortment of 13 18mm 6-sided dice of one breed of daemon (the breed is indicated on the sticker on the front of the box). Collect more boosters from a single breed to enhance the power of those daemons, or combine different booster packs to create hellish new varieties to send into the arena to fight for you.

—description from the publisher

Name: Deamon Dice: Fire Booster Pack
Description:
Each Daemon Dice Booster provides a new breed of fiendish gladiators to send into the Infernal Arena. New Purebreed abilities can change the tide of battle. Any breeds can be combined to create new combinations to ensure your minion is the last one standing (or at least squirming).

Fire daemon (red plastic/yellow ink): When fighting against fire, a slight graze can burn and scorch your flesh! Each turn, one stun damage from an undefended attack from a fire daemon's body part becomes a wound instead.

Each Daemon Dice Booster pack contains a random assortment of 13 18mm 6-sided dice of one breed of daemon (the breed is indicated on the sticker on the front of the box). Collect more boosters from a single breed to enhance the power of those daemons, or combine different booster packs to create hellish new varieties to send into the arena to fight for you.

—description from the publisher

Name: Deamon Dice: Stench Booster Pack
Description:
Each Daemon Dice Booster provides a new breed of fiendish gladiators to send into the Infernal Arena. New Purebreed abilities can change the tide of battle. Any breeds can be combined to create new combinations to ensure your minion is the last one standing (or at least squirming).

Stench daemon (yellow plastic/black ink): The foul odor of a stench daemon is so strong it can stun by itself! This is treated as a stun attack that cannot be defended or modified, and is suffered as normal during Suffer Stuns & Wounds.

Each Daemon Dice Booster pack contains a random assortment of 13 18mm 6-sided dice of one breed of daemon (the breed is indicated on the sticker on the front of the box). Collect more boosters from a single breed to enhance the power of those daemons, or combine different booster packs to create hellish new varieties to send into the arena to fight for you.

—description from the publisher

Name: Deamon Dice: Wraith Booster Pack
Description:
Each Daemon Dice Booster provides a new breed of fiendish gladiators to send into the Infernal Arena. New Purebreed abilities can change the tide of battle. Any breeds can be combined to create new combinations to ensure your minion is the last one standing (or at least squirming).

Wraith daemon (blue plastic/red ink): It is hard to get an advantageous position against a foe that can fade out of existence! At the beginning of each turn, a wraith daemon ignores the minusing effects of one die of its choice, even a Lung or a Wing!

Each Daemon Dice Booster pack contains a random assortment of 13 18mm 6-sided dice of one breed of daemon (the breed is indicated on the sticker on the front of the box). Collect more boosters from a single breed to enhance the power of those daemons, or combine different booster packs to create hellish new varieties to send into the arena to fight for you.

—description from the publisher

Name: Word Turners
Description:
Word Turners is a fun alphabet playing card game for 2-6 players, with the simple aim 'who can make the longest word?'It is a game for the whole family and has no time consuming set up, just shuffle and play. There are 60 cards in pack 1 instruction card, 2x 26 alphabet cards and introducing the choice card for which there are 7!

Simply shuffle the cards and deal 7 cards per player, then everyone looks at their cards and decides how many if any to swap, you only get one chance to swap so choose wisely! The choice cards can be any letter you choose! Then when everyone is ready they turn their cards to reveal their word. If there is a draw symbols on  cards come in play.

The player with the longest word wins the hand. In the event of a tie, the person with the highest scoring word wins.

Name: Diggrie
Description:
Diggrie is a two-player game played on a 5x5 grid, with each player having five flat discs and one taller king disc in their color.

To win, you must create in your color a row of four pieces or a square of pieces. You can move over unoccupied spaces; jumping is not allowed. The game includes three variants, and if you include the king piece in play, it needs to be part of the winning row or square.

Name: Cuinze
Description: Cuinze is a shedding game of luck, memory, skill and strategy. It is a competitive game: be the first to play all of your tiles and you WIN! At game's end, players are ordered from first place to last place. As long as you are in the top half of all players, you are still a winner! It is fast-paced: there is little waiting between turns, and a game normally ends within 10 minutes. Rules are straightforward and easy to learn. The game teaches young children how to track and sequence numbers, recognize patterns, assess probabilities, and develop strategies: the game avoids use of face cards that impede learning of numbers. It is family friendly (ages 8 and up) - adults will not dominate! It is great for groups: an unlimited number of players (with more boxes) can easily play together in one giant game. Freestanding tiles provide a satisfying tactile experience; no racks are needed and no more fumbling to hide cards.

Name: 紅裸々(Kurara)
Description:
The game ç´…è£¸ã€…(Kurara) comes with a single tile. The rules present three ways to play, each of them involve the players using a single finger, dragged across the top of the tile, in an attempt to stand it up.  In each of the variations, the player who can most efficiently and repeatedly stand the tile will win.

The game's title is word-play that references a famous scene of the popular anime show Heidi, Girl of the Alps (ã‚¢ãƒ«ãƒ—ã‚¹ã®å°‘å¥³ãƒã‚¤ã‚¸), in which one of the characters, a young girl called Clara Sesemann (ã‚¯ãƒ©ãƒ©ãƒ»ã‚¼ãƒ¼ã‚¼ãƒžãƒ³, pronounced as Kurara ZÄ“zeman in Japanese), stands up from her wheelchair.

Name: UNO Stacko Travel Size Bonus Pak
Description: A bundled set of the UNO Stacko dexterity game and the UNO card game.

Name: BattleTech: Salvage Box – Urbanmech
Description:
The BattleTech Salvage Box: UrbanMech is an expansion for use in the classic BattleTech tabletop and Alpha Strike games.

The box contains:
• one plastic Urbanmech miniature
• one double-sided Alpha Strike dry-erase card (UM-R60 UrbanMech / UM-R63 UrbanMech)
• one double-sided Pilot Card (Evangeline Cantwell / Kirax)

Name: BattleTech: Salvage Box – Clan Invasion
Description:
The BattleTech Salvage Box is a blind box containing one plastic miniature for use in the classic BattleTech tabletop and Alpha Strike games. The box also provides one double-sided Alpha Strike dry-erase card, and one double-sided Pilot Card.

The BattleTech Salvage Box was created as a part of the Clan Invasion Kickstarter 2019.

The miniature in each Salvage Box is determined randomly, although the Alpha Strike dry-erase card and Pilot Card match the OmniMech.

Name: Anthems of War
Description:
Welcome to Anthems of War, a bring your own miniatures fantasy skirmish game. Your battles are the stories told by rival bards in a tavern. You not only control the forces on the field but also play the role of the bard, embellishing the story as you play. Maybe a fog bank rolls in, keeping your rogue’s flanking attack concealed. What if that common soldier steps up to lead your forces after his commander is consumed by a wall of flame? Wouldn’t it be a shame if a sudden downpour wet the strings of an elven ranger’s bow just before she was about to fire a shot? With these narrative elements, no battle will ever be the same.

Anthems of War is a fantasy miniatures skirmish game designed to be played head to head by two players with options for more. Prototyped using 15mm and 28mm miniatures players move their characters on the battlefield, roll dice and try to get the upper hand against their opponents using a variety of different scenarios and goals.

Scenarios can be used to represent single conflicts or they can be linked together in an overarching campaign. With a system that introduces narrative elements to the gameplay and the ability to create any characters you can dream up no two scenarios ever play quite the same.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Docentis
Description:
Docentis is a game where you become a PE teacher whose goal is to plan an innovation project for the class. For that purpose, you will have to meet your students’ specific needs, manage playground spaces, consider meteorology, defective material, internship students and all kind of contingencies that may affect your planning. You may need to take care of the students during their break, substitute another teacher or respond to a headmaster’s request. Will you finish the day exhausted, or will you have some energy left for teacher’s training after class? Will you be able to carry out your dreamed project?

The goal is to obtain the highest score amongst all the players by obtaining the different parts of each project. Some of them are:
-    Curricular elements: educational goals, skills, contents, and evaluation.
-    Methodological elements: teaching styles and pedagogical models.
-    Teacher cards from other subjects’ colleagues, training courses or school trips.

Players will take turns to discover the school facilities in the game board, trying to obtain their project’s element cards. 
Energy will be the currency of exchange to get the elements and will increase or decrease during the course of the game.

At the end of the 6th shift (6th hour of class), a count will be made of the elements achieved (+2) and those that remain to be achieved (-1). The one with the highest score will be the winner of the game.

In its educational version, once the game is over, the elements obtained can be used to develop a real case study.


Docentis es un juego en el que te convertirás en docente de Educación Física que debe planificar un proyecto de innovación para su clase. Para ello, deberás atender a las necesidades específicas de tus estudiantes, gestionar los espacios del patio, tener en cuenta la meteorología, el material defectuoso, la llegada de los estudiantes de prácticas y otras muchas situaciones que acontecen en el transcurso del día que dificultarán o facilitarán tus planes (recreos, sustituciones, avisos de dirección, etc.) ¿Terminarás agotado al finalizar el día o te queda energía para un curso de formación? ¿Serás capaz de lograr el proyecto soñado?      El objetivo del juego es convertirte en la persona que consiga la máxima puntuación, que estará determinada por la obtención de los diferentes elementos que componen cada proyecto. Algunos de ellos son:
-    Elementos curriculares: Objetivos, competencias, contenidos y evaluación
-    Elementos metodológicos: Estilos de enseñanza y modelos pedagógicos
-    Además de cartas de profesorado de otras materias, cursos de formación o excursiones.

Turno a turno, las personas que juegan recorrerán por el tablero las diferentes instalaciones de su centro educativo consiguiendo distintas cartas de elemento que componen su proyecto. Su energía será la moneda de cambio que deberán gestionar durante toda la partida. Ahora bien, la limitación de recursos y espacios generarán encuentros y sinergias entre compañeros de departamento que se verán obligados a cooperar si quieren alzarse con la victoria. 
Todos aquellos elementos conseguidos otorgarán puntos positivos y aquellos que no se logren puntuarán en negativo. Cuando el día lectivo haya finalizado, si eres el profesor que más se acercó al proyecto planificado… ¡ganarás la partida! 
En su versión educativa, una vez finalizado el juego se puede utilizar el resultado de la partida para desarrollar un supuesto práctico real con los elementos conseguido. Sin duda, un interesante serious game para futuros docentes.

Name: Spy Shuffle
Description:
Spy Shuffle is an exciting spy themes card game where opponents battle to become the Top Spy. Played by 2-5 players from age 7+, it has a play time of 15-30 minutes.

The game is played by rolling a die and picking up cards according to the number that was rolled. Players starts with two cards. The first player rolls the die and picks up the number of cards that  corresponds to the number rolled on the die, If an "ACTION" card is picked up, the player  announces to the other players that they have an "ACTION" and proceed to follow the instructions listed on the Action card,  after the player performs all actions on the card, then it becomes the next player's turn.

The game is won by collecting 5 special spy cards, but there are bumps and blockages along the way via Action cards that dictate your actions and what cards you keep or let go of. Wild cards are also in the mix that causes you to exchange half your hand with another player and Snitch cards that you can use to affect your opponents win…….becoming Top Spy is the aim but only if you can play your cards right.

Name: Too Many Bones: Rage of Tyranny
Description:
The Tyrants of Daelore are back, and they're more challenging than ever! An expansion to both Too Many Bones and Too Many Bones:Undertow, Rage of Tyranny introduces a new, alternate way to fight every Tyrant in both games.  Featuring new chips and dice, as well as new shadow cards and final battles for every Tyrant, Rage of Tyranny adds new hours of replayability to your Too Many Bones collection.

17 Chips
9 Dice
53 Tyrant and Encounter Cards
1 Chip Holder
1 PVC Card Box
2 Rule Cards
